unnormalised: Okay, so the Govt just released the Q3 fiscal report. Turns out, the GDP growth is at 7.2%, which is a bit lower than what everyone predicted, around 7.5%. The Finance Minister, Nirmala Sitharaman ji, mentioned that the infrastructure spend for the next quarter is going up by Rs. 50,000 crores.
normalised: Okay, so the Government just released the Q three fiscal report. Turns out, the G-D-P growth is at seven point two percent, which is a bit lower than what everyone predicted, around seven point five percent. The Finance Minister, Nirmala Sitharaman ji, mentioned that the infrastructure spend for the next quarter is going up by rupee fifty thousand crore.

unnormalised: Apparently, a lot of the shortfall is due to lower-than-expected tax collection. GST collections were around ₹1.4 lakh crore, which sounds like a lot, but it's apparently a bit behind target. They're also looking at revising the budget deficit target – currently at 6.4% of the GDP.
normalised: Apparently, a lot of the shortfall is due to lower than expected tax collection. G-S-T collections were around rupee one point four lakh crore, which sounds like a lot, but it's apparently a bit behind target. They're also looking at revising the budget deficit target – currently at six point four percent of the G-D-P.

unnormalised: Analysts are saying that this might mean interest rates will stay higher for longer. Banks like HDFC and ICICI could see some impact on their lending. Plus, with inflation still hovering around 5.5%, the RBI might have to step in again soon. Let's see what happens in the next review.
normalised: Analysts are saying that this might mean interest rates will stay higher for longer. Banks like H-D-F-C and I-C-I-C-I could see some impact on their lending. Plus, with inflation still hovering around five point five percent, the R-B-I might have to step in again soon. Let's see what happens in the next review.
